headline.main: Holiday Travel Volume Looks Steady, but Americans Are Staying Close to the Ground

lead_paragraph: Mike Norwood, a freshman at the College of the Holy Cross in Worcester, Mass., never intended to begin the Thanksgiving holiday with his parents in Washington as early as Tuesday. He had wanted to travel today. But when he tried booking a train from Boston to Washington, he was told that all the trains were sold out, forcing him to leave a day early.
